description: Vicki Nelson, an ex-police detective with Retinitis Pigmentosa, gets caught up in an investigation after she witnesses a murder and the victim's girlfriend asks her to prove it was committed by a vampire.
tags: ['nightclub', 'red apple', 'pentagram', 'erlenmeyer flask', 'test tube', 'tabloid', 'running through traffic']
synopsis_with_character_names:
Private Investigator Vicki Nelson [Christina Cox] is walking home from a bad date when she witnesses a murder taking place in a nearby alley. Immediately hanging up her cellphone, she crosses the busy traffic to intervene and sees a man in a long black cape running from the scene. Vicki gives chase, but the man disappears after he turns into a dead-end alcove. When Vicki's ex-partner, Detective Mike Celluci [Dylan Neal], and his new partner Dave Graham [Keith Dallas] show up, they find that the victim's neck has been torn open and the body drained of blood. The next day, news of the "Vampire Killer" makes headlines in the Toronto Sun, and Vicki is visited by Coreen Fennel [Gina Holden], the gothy girlfriend of the victim. Coreen was on the phone with Ian when he was attacked, and Coreen wants Vicki's help finding the killer, whom she believes to be a real vampire. Vicki isn't convinced, but when Coreen tells her about the man in the long black cape, Vicki decides there might be more to this murder than meets the eye and decides to investigate further.

That night, Vicki returns to the alley to look for clues. She finds a pentagram on the wall and takes a sample of some substance she thinks might be blood. Suddenly, she notices a young man also looking around, but when she tries to talk with him, he disappears. Next stop is the morgue, where coroner Rajani Mohadevan [Nimet Kanji] has concluded that the wounds on Ian's throat were made by razorsharp teeth. She also tests the substance Vicki brought in and concludes that, indeed, it is blood. Dr Mohadevan agrees to compare the blood sample against Ian's blood to see if they match. That night, Vicki gets a call from Mike. He's learned that Vicki visited Dr Mohadevan and wants to trade information with Vicki. Mike reveals that he thinks the killer may have gotten his unusual strength from drugs, maybe crystal meth or PCP, and that the wounds might have been made by a glove with razors attached to the fingers, Freddie Krueger-style. He also thinks that the blood might have been harvested for a cult ritual. In return, Vicki reveals that her client is Ian Reddick's girlfriend who believes Ian was killed by a real vampire. After Mike calls the idea "ridiculous," Vicki agrees that it's unbelievable, but she still wants to check out Club Nervosa, the bar where Ian worked.

Meanwhile, vampire Henry Fitzroy [Kyle Schmid] hasn't been sleeping either. He has learned from a cute waitress that Ian used to work at Club Nervosa. The club is really hopping when Henry gets there. He recognizes Vicki (from last night in the alley) and tries using his power of persuasion to get her to reveal why she is at the club, but it doesn't seem to work on Vicki. So, Henry asks around for information about Ian and learns that he had trouble with a few of the other regulars. While Vicki goes over the same ground with the bartender, Henry links up with the regulars by offering them money. They go outside to talk, and Henry quickly detects that they had nothing to do with Ian's murder or with the "evil behind it." However, the regulars decide that they want more money for their info and gang up on Henry. Henry easily knocks them to the ground just as Vicki comes out of the bar. Vicki watches as Henry leaps to a roof.

The next day, Vicki returns to the morgue to see what Dr Mohadevan has learned about the blood sample. Turns out to be Ian's blood, but she has also discovered in her lab tests that there is saliva around the bite marks on Ian's neck and that the saliva doesn't match any known species, human or animal. In addition, she found a substance under the fingernails of another of the vampire killer's victims. The substance is similar to batwings, she tells Vicki, but not the wings of any known species of bat. What is going on, Vicki wonders. Count Dracula on a bender? Dr Mohadevan reminds Vicki to keep an open mind as there are more things out there that aren't dreamt about in a police training manual.

What IS going on is that ubergeek Norman Bridewell [Michael Eklund] has succeeded in summoning a demon who is providing him with money, fancy clothes, and a Porsche but demands blood in return. So far, he has taken three victims, including Ian. Norman's fondest wish, however, is to make the cute goth chick who works at the University Pub, Coreen Ferrel, fall in love with him. Unfortunately, the demon does not have the power to control love, but he promises Norman that only two more victims are needed to unleash a more powerful demon who does have the power to give Norman everything he desires. Norman has already picked out his next victim, a pretty blonde who spurned his advances, and informs the demon that she will be in a nearby park that very night.

Meanwhile, Vicki has charted the locations of the murders on a city map and noticed that they are beginning to take the shape of the pentagram that she found on the alley wall. Deducing that the next murder is going to be committed in a nearby park, she hurries over. Henry has also hit upon the pentagram shape of the murders and hurries over to the same park. The blonde is walking through the park when she is attacked by the demon. Henry leaps in to save the girl. The demon recognizes Henry and announces that his master will soon be coming for Henry. The demon then turns into a cloud of bats and flies away. Suddenly, Vicki jumps in and finds Henry leaning over the girl's body. She goes after Henry, but Henry knocks her out just as the police arrive. Afraid of being detected, Henry grabs Vicki's limp body and carries it off with him. [Full synopsis by bj_kuehl]

description: Vicki learns the truth about Henry, and their lives get more dangerous as Norman escalates his requests.
tags: ['black bra']
synopsis_with_character_names:
NOTE: Continuation of Blood Price: Part One.

Vicki awakens to find herself lying on a sofa in Henry's living room. At first, she fears that Henry is the killer. Henry admits that he is a vampire and demonstrates it by running a knife through his palm and showing his fangs, but he tells her that the killer is actually a demon who is being summoned by a human, and he would like to team with Vicki, since Henry cannot work during the daytime. Vicki agrees, and asks Henry how he knows so much about demons. Henry explains how, in 1890s London, he came upon a Satanic cult called Hellfire. Their leader had summoned a demon named Astaroth from whom they requested eternal life. In return, they offered "the nightwalker" Henry to Astaroth. Astaroth asked Henry to open the portal that would let him pass into this world, but Henry refused and sent Astaroth back to hell. Henry is certain that the demon who has been killing people in Toronto is attempting to open that portal. If that happens and Astaroth enters this world, all hell will break loose, Henry tells Vicki.

Since dawn is approaching and he must sleep, Henry suggests that Vicki search the police files for a rash of thefts, as minor demons can only gift their summoners with material goods that they steal from someone else. Vicki jaunts over to the police station and requests the reports from recent thefts. She finds several, all concentrated in the university area. Still too big an area, Henry says when Vicki later shows him her findings. Instead, Henry performs a ritual that reveals the demon will strike again in Bikeman's Park.

Once night has settled on the city, Vicki and Henry go walking in Bikeman's Park. Suddenly, they hear a scream. The demon has taken one victim and is turning on another. Henry and Vicki jump in and fight him until the demon gives up, turns into a horde of bats, and flies away. Unfortunately, Henry has been stabbed several times and needs blood. Vicki rolls up her sleeve and offers him her arm. Henry drinks just enough to keep from dying. Vicki escorts him back to his condo where she spends the day tending to him while he sleeps. By that evening, Henry is healed, so they meet with Dr Betty Sagara [Linda Sorensen] , a professor of Demonology at the university and one of the few individuals who knows about Henry. Dr Sagara gives them a list of students who have recently shown an overinterest in demonology.

The next day, Vicki starts looking up the people on the list. Meanwhile, Norman has enticed Coreen to his house by telling her that he knows how to find the vampire that killed Ian. Before she goes off with Norman, Coreen leaves a message on Vicki's cellphone about meeting Norman. When Coreen gets in the Porsche, however, Norman chloroforms her, takes her to his apartment, and ties her up. When Vicki hears Coreen's message on her cell, she notices that one of the people on Sagara's list is named Norman Bridewell. It gives the address, so she calls Henry to tell him where she is going. She asks Henry to hurry over as soon as he wakes up. Then she heads over to Norman's house where she finds Coreen gagged and tied to a chair. Norman suddenly leaps from a closet and knocks Vicki out. As he ties Vicki up, Norman says to Coreen, "I think we have our next sacrifice."

When Vicki finally comes to, Norman has summoned the demon. When Norman offers Vicki as a sacrifice, the demon disappears and Astaroth takes his place. Just as Norman is about to stab Vicki, Henry flies in the door and starts reciting the incantation that will force Astaroth back to hell. Astaroth screams "No!", takes Norman instead, and promises Henry that he will be back for him. Mike rushes in just in time to see Astaroth disappear. As Vicki, Henry, and Coreen file out the door, Mike stands dumbfounded.

Epilogue: Coreen promises not to breathe a word about Henry and applies for a job as Vicki's office assistant. Vicki has somehow had black pentagrams burned into her wrists. Henry thanks her for assisting him, and they vow to keep in touch, since it looks like Astaroth has them both marked. [Full synopsis by bj_kuehl]

description: Vicki gets caught up in voodoo when she tries to locate her client's brother.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Vicki Nelson has just met with a potential client at the Juju Lounge. Angelique Jerroux wants help locating her brother Royale. After the floods following hurricane Katrina in New Orleans, Royale fell in with someone named Henri Gregoire and went missing. After discussing particulars, Vicki and Angelique walk out to their cars, accompanied by Angelique's buff friend Jean-Marc. Suddenly, they are attacked by a lumbering, gray-skinned, nonbreathing hulk of a man with glazed-over eyes and no pupils. Vicki tells Angelique to run, then she tries to fight off the attacker. The next thing Vicki knows is that Jean-Marc is dead and her ex-partner Mike Celluci is on the scene sizing up the murder. Of course, Mike can't buy Vicki's description of the attacker.

It was a zombie, explains Henry Fitzroy, when Vicki later asks for his help. The trick will be to locate whomever created the zombie and break the connection, Henry advises. He also warns her that it will be dangerous, having himself had some doings with Haitian voodoo in the past. First on the to-do list is to talk with Angelique. Henry and Vicki return to the Juju Lounge to see if the bartender knows where to find her but he won't talk, so they wait outside and follow him when he goes running to Angelique. He leads them to an abandoned warehouse where they are surprised to see Angelique mumbling jumbo in front of a candlelit voodoo altar. Angelique admits to being a Voodoo Mambo (high priestess), she and her brother having followed in their parents' footsteps after they were both murdered by practitioners of Dark Voodoo.

Vicki suggests that Angelique come stay at her office where she will be safer. Coreen is excited to meet a real Mambo and agrees to keep Angelique company while Vicki and Henry go in search of Gregoire. They return to the Juju Lounge where they find the bartender has been murdered. In the poolroom, they see the zombie getting up from the floor. Henry tries to fight him, but the zombie is virtually unstoppable until Vicki runs a poker through his chest and nails him to the wall. The next morning, Vicki goes down to the TPD (Toronto Police Department) and learns from Mike that Gregoire goes by the name of Papa Samedi and runs a hoodoo/voodoo business out of the MacMillan Building on King West. That evening, Henry and Vicki head down to Samedi's place. Angelique wants to come along, but Vicki advises Angelique to stay safe, so Angelique places a protection bracelet on Vicki for her safety, too.

Papa Samedi immediately recognizes that Henry is a vampire and asks them what they want. Vicki explains that they are looking for Angelique's brother, and Samedi laughs. He calls Angelique the "Voodoo Queen" and explains that she and her brother are the "family from hell," both practitioners of Dark Voodoo. Samedi explains how the "crone" keeps her youthful appearance by killing innocent children and feeding on their hearts while they are still beating. He admits to killing Royale and burying his bones in a cemetery in Toronto, but he keeps Royale's soul in a glowing green amulet that he wears around his neck. Angelique's intention, according to Samedi, is to get back her brother's body and restore him to life. If she does that, Samedi warns, children will start dying in Toronto, too.

Meanwhile, Coreen is watching as Angelique conducts a voodoo ceremony that Coreen thinks is a love spell to get a certain vampire to fall in love with her. When Coreen keeps interrupting the juju with her comments, Angelique hisses at her to shut up and takes away Coreen's mouth. Suddenly, Samedi's zombie collapses and so does Samedi. That old girl, he mumbles, must have used Vicki in order to get to him and steal his soul. Vicki rips the bracelet from her wrist and tosses it aside, but it is too late. With his dying breath, Samedi begs them not to let Angelique get hold of the amulet around his neck.

Remembering the Angelique is with Coreen, Vicki grabs the amulet, and she and Henry race back to the office. They find Coreen with her mouth missing and Angelique holding a Vicki voodoo doll. Vicki tries to rush her, but Angelique squeezes the doll and Vicki collapses in pain. Angelique places a worm inside the doll and threatens to tell it to eat Vicki from the inside out unless Vicki hands over the amulet by tomorrow night so that she can use it to resurrect her brother. Then Angelique disappears into the dawn. Fortunately, when Angelique disappears, Coreen gets back her mouth. While Henry returns to his condo to sleep for the day, Vicki gives Coreen the task of calling all the cemeteries in Toronto to see if any of them buried a body that was shipped from New Orleans after Katrina struck. After a day of telephoning, Coreen hits paydirt. A body from New Orleans was shipped to Mount Pleasant Cemetery eleven months ago. Payment was in cash, and the name given was Damballah, whom Coreen recognizes as a voodoo sky serpent.

Still in pain, Vicki heads to Mt Pleasant to look for Royale's body. When Henry wakes up and calls to see how Vicki is doing, Coreen tells him that Vicki is at Mt Pleasant. She also informs Henry that one of the books she read about voodoo said that salt would stop a zombie. If they taste salt, a zombie will be reminded of their mortality and return to the grave. Henry grabs a box of salt and rushes out the door. Meanwhile, Vicki has found a crypt with the name "Damballah" over the door. She goes inside and encounters Angelique preparing for a ceremony. By the time Henry finds the Damballah crypt, he finds Vicki lying on an stone slab. Henry dangles the amulet in front of Angelique and tells her to release Vicki.

Suddenly, a zombie grabs Henry from behind and holds him securely so that Angelique can take the amulet from Henry's hand. When Angelique raises a dagger and prepares to sacrifice Vicki's life in trade for Royale's, Henry wrestles the zombie to the ground and pours salt in his mouth. Henry then sees the Vicki doll and makes a grab for it. He pulls out the worm, and Vicki's pain stops. Vicki punches Angelique a good one, giving Henry time to grab the amulet and crumble it in the palm of his hand. Angelique screams "No!" as Royale's bony arm reaches out of his tomb and pulls Angelique in with him. Henry pulls Vicki from the crypt just seconds before the angry Damballah causes it to explode. Henry offers Vicki the Vicki doll, but she doesn't want it. They kiss, thank each other, and part ways.

Epilogue: Mike drops by Vicki's office for her explanation about the bodies he just found in and around the exploded crypt in the Mt Pleasant Cemetery. Vicki suggests they do lunch. [Full synopsis by bj_kuehl]

description: When Vicki goes looking for a dead-beat dad, she finds a little more supernatural, and many more memories, than she wants.
synopsis_with_character_names:
When Celeste Jeffries is murdered, leaving behind an 8-year old daughter, Celeste's aged mother Emily hires Vicki Nelson to find Sarah's father Steve, who deserted the family a year ago. From Mike Celluci, Vicki learns that Celeste was found in the kitchen ridden with bites and claw marks, as if she was attacked by a wild animal, and that the police do not suspect her runaway husband of having anything to do with it. Vicki watches a TPD tape on which Sarah is interviewed about her mother's murder, but Sarah denies that anyone was in the house. She claims her mother simply went into the kitchen, called her name, and then began screaming. Vicki's gut tells her that Sarah is hiding something, so she pays a visit to the Cobb Academy for Gifted Children, where Sarah is currently residing. Vicki attempts to talk with Sarah about her father, but it quickly becomes apparent that Sarah believes her father hates her.

Vicki calls Henry Fitzroy to accompany her to Celeste's house to search for anything that might tell them where Steve is currently living. The blood on the kitchen floor makes Henry hungry, but he curbs his appetite and helps Vicki look through the mail. They find nothing from Steve, but they do notice a drawing made by Sarah of her mother in the kitchen with an orange monster. The drawing was mailed to Celeste a week ago by Sarah's art teacher, Laurel. A note attached to the picture says, "Celeste, call me." Henry diagnoses a vivid imagination, but Vicki photographs the drawing and takes it with her. A visit with Coroner Rajani reveals that whatever tore Celeste up was angry because it continued to bite and claw even after she was dead, however, there was no saliva found in the bites. Henry shows Rajani the drawing of the monster and asks whether it could have killed Celeste. Rajani says, "Yes, if it existed." Henry is beginning to believe the drawing is actually a "photo from a crime scene," but Vicki is still putting her money on Steve Jeffries.

With nothing more to go on other than that Steve is a mechanic and likes old cars, Vicki has Coreen call around to see if she can locate him. By sundown the next day, Coreen hits paydirt. Steve Jeffries works at a Vintage Auto garage in Maypole. Vicki pays him a visit, but Steve produces an ironclad alibi. Furthermore, he wants nothing to do with his daughter. Vicki talks with Mike and finds out that phone records show that Steve made a call to the Cobb Academy, so it's back to Cobb to talk again with Sarah, who still maintains that her father hates her because she was bad. Having been abandoned by her own father when she was young, Vicki tries to explain that it wasn't Sarah's fault her father left. In an attempt to psychologize, Vicki shows the drawing to Sarah and asks if the monster was her dad. "That's Buttercup," Sarah says, and holds up her orange stuffed animal. "Buttercup wouldn't hurt anyone."

Vicki goes to the art room to talk with Laurel. At first, Laurel is reluctant to say anything but finally admits that it was she who talked with Steve. She was becoming worried because Sarah's drawings were becoming more violent recently, and she wanted Steve to know that Celeste was planning to move Sarah into another school, something that Laurel actually supported. It was her impression, however, that Steve didn't much care. Unbeknown to both Vicki and Laurel, Cobb is listening at the door to their conversation. Cobb retreats into a locked room in which students are working one-on-one with their teachers. He singles out Sarah and tells her that Laurel is planning to send her away and to take Buttercup from her. Sarah becomes upset and lights start flashing and tables rattling. Cobb further goads Sarah, telling her that Laurel wants her out of her class and that Laurel hates her. "Then I hate her!" Sarah replies, grasping Buttercup tightly. "Let Buttercup go," Cobb orders. In the art room, an orange monster suddenly appears and goes after Laurel. Vicki is thrown to the floor and screams at Laurel to run.

Later that evening, Vicki and Henry pay another visit to Steve. Steve refuses to get involved until Henry uses his powers of persuasion. Steve shows them the claw marks on his chest and tells how Sarah's doll Buttercup almost killed him. Sarah is telekinetic, he explains, and she has gotten worse after being at Cobb Academy. It was in fear of his life that he ran away, and he's not about to go back even if it means abandoning his daughter to Cobb. When Vicki returns to the office with some fast food for dinner, Coreen informs her that Steve just called and said he had a change of heart and was going over to the Cobb Academy to rescue his daughter. Afraid for Steve's safety, Vicki phones Henry and asks him to meet her right away at the Academy. Henry jumps in his car, not knowing that he's being followed by Mike, who has been conducting a background check on Henry and becoming disturbed by what he is finding, i.e., Henry has NO background, draws a comic book called Blood Price, and appears heavily into blood.

Vicki gets to the Academy first and intercepts Steve. Together, they intercept Cobb as he's going into the locked room. Sarah is pleased to see her father until Cobb says that her dad has come to take Buttercup away. Sarah gets angry, hugs Buttercup, and lights begin to flash. Meanwhile, Henry and Mike have made it to the Academy. They join together and start looking for Vicki. When they can't get through the locked door, Mike goes searching for another way in, and Henry simply breaks the door down. They find Vicki trying to explain to Sarah that her father loves her and that he's proven it by coming back for her. Henry vamps out and puts Cobb in a neck lock until Sarah realizes that it was Cobb who has been lying to her all along. Sarah runs into her father's arms and they hug each other.

Epilogue: Cobb is placed in custody. Sarah throws Buttercup away and goes home with her dad. Having seen Henry vamp out, Mike now realizes Henry is a vampire, and he's not happy about it. [Full synopsis by bj_kuehl]

description: Vicki runs up against a Celtic spell when she investigates why a judge, prosecutor and defense attorney are being targeted.
synopsis_with_character_names:
When Barbara Stamp's husband, defense attorney Fred Stamp, is found dead from an apparent heart attack, Barbara hires Vicki Nelson to investigate Magnus O'Connor, a convicted killer whom Fred failed to successfully defend. The reason Barbara suspects that Magnus had something to do with it is because of a threatening message she found from Magnus on her husband's voicemail saying, "You failed me. You're a dead man." Vicki learns from Mike Celluci that Magnus has a long record of assaults, including six hits with the Irish mob in Montreal. The only problem is that a week ago Magnus committed suicide in his jail cell. On Henry Fitzroy's suggestion that Magnus might have hired someone to kill Stamp, Vicki pays a visit to his family. Magnus's mother, Lavena, is not willing to talk and orders Vicki to leave their house. Just before Vicki leaves, Magnus's brother Brady warns her that anyone who crosses the O'Connor family gets hurt.

With no leads there, Vicki talks with Coroner Rajani Mohadevan whose autopsy showed unusual bruises on Stamp's heart, as though someone reached into his chest and squeezed his heart until it stopped beating. Dr Rajani also shares with Vicki the report of Magnus's death, including the drawing of a large pentagram that he inflicted upon himself prior to killing himself. Further information from Mike reveals that Magnus was found lying within a circle of salt and candles. When Henry hears the details, he suspects that Magnus may have been performing a Celtic ritual meant to give him powers beyond the grave. Against his better judgement, Henry suggests that he and Vicki visit a psychic reader to obtain more information about the ritual. Sinead happens to be one of Henry's problematic ex-lovers, but she is able to identify the ritual as Wiccan last rites, a cleansing spell meant to pave the way to the afterlife. Sinead also recognizes the pentagrams on Vicki's wrists as being concentrations of power.

The next day, Vicki learns that George Neely, the prosecuting attorney at Magnus's trial, has also been found dead under the same circumstances as Fred Stamp. This time, Rajani has been able to take fingerprint visualizations from both Neely and Stamp's hearts, and she has matched them to those of Magnus O'Connor. Vicki and Henry decide to snoop around Carmichael's apartment but are surprised to find Diesel Swanson guarding it. Swanson rushes at Henry, but Henry steps aside and Swanson jumps off the second floor balcony and runs away. Snooping in the wastebasket, Vicki finds a page of computer codes that Coreen is later able to trace to a website for The Necrodrome. The website shows highlights from the fight between Swanson and Blundell and contains a countdown until the next fight, which is scheduled to take place in less than 24 hours. Vicki immediately contacts Mike. After taking a look at The Necrodrome website, Mike and Vicki are able to piece together the story. Carmichael resurrected Carl Blundell in order to create The Necrodrome, but he needed a challenger, so he slipped paracetamol into Diesel's drink, killing him. He then resurrected Diesel Swanson for the Swanson vs Blundell fight, but now that Blundell is out of commission, he's going to need another challenger.

While Mike gets the computer technie at TPD to triangulate the location of the website broadcast, Henry listens closely to the broadcast itself to see if he can hear anything that might help them determine the location. In both cases, they are led to a warehouse near Union Station. Mike gets there first and finds Diesel Swanson being held in a cage. Diesel pleads with Mike to let him die, but before Mike can do anything, he sees someone in an Anubis mask leading William Carmichael with a bullet hole between his eyes. "I think we've found our next challenger," says "Anubis". When Vicki and Henry arrive at the warehouse, Vicki sees Mike's car and notices a number of men streaming in the door to the warehouse. After the last man enters and the bouncer closes the door, Henry knocks him out. Vicki then enters the warehouse and instructs Henry to wait three minutes then come barreling up to the door in Mike's car with the sirens blaring.

Inside the warehouse, Vicki sees Mike in the cage with Diesel and William. When the sirens from Mike's car start blaring, Vicki yells to "Anubis" to put his hands up. However, "Anubis" has appropriated Mike's gun, and he points it at Vicki. He then pulls off his mask, revealing himself to be Ivan Olonoff. Just as Ivan locks Vicki in the cage with Mike, Diesel, and William, Henry jumps Ivan, knocking him out. Diesel grabs Mike, and William goes after Vicki, but she is able to break his neck. Henry rips open the cage, releasing Vicki who tosses him a bag containing the broken half of Diesel's clay tablet. Diesel grabs the tablet and starts to walk out of the arena, saying that he wants to see his wife. Vicki reminds him that he's in no condition to do that but Henry suggests an alternative.

Diesel has been returned to the Mortuary. As he lies on the embalming table, Darlene is led in to share a private moment with her "dead" husband. She holds his hand, tells him she loves him, and is then led away by Vicki. Henry hands Diesel the clay tablet and, with tears in his eyes, Diesel places it in his mouth and expires. [Full synopsis by bj_kuehl]

description: Vicki goes undercover at a fertility clinic that has an astounding rate of success.
synopsis_with_character_names:
Mitch and Marlisse Lafoy had been trying for years to have a baby without success until they discovered the Hobman Clinic. Within a short time, Marlisse became pregnant. Something changed, however, as the pregnancy progressed. Marlisse is now living at the Clinic and refusing to see or even speak to her husband on grounds that his "negativity aura" is adversely affecting her pregnancy. Mitch believes that the Clinic has some sort of cultish hold over his wife, and he has hired P.I. Vicki Nelson to investigate. Vicki thinks the best way to investigate might be to go undercover, so she and TPD Detective Mike Celluci, posing as Mike and Vicki Wheeler, are going to avail themselves of the Hobman "Total Body" Technique.

After an initial interview with the Clinic's creator, Dr Richard Hobman, and his assurance that he can help Vicki to conceive a child, the first line of business is to obtain a sample of Mike's "swimmers." After a number of kisses with "wife" Vicki (for show only, of course), Mike is led away and Vicki is left to fill out forms and to undergo a physical examination. While Vicki is busy and after Mike has done his part, he is free to leave the Clinic, so Vicki has asked him to run a check on Richard Hobman. The profile comes up clean. No complaints, no lawsuits, and the Hobman Clinic has a success rate twice that of other fertility clinics. Hobman's ex-partner, Dr Weaver, portrays Hobman as a dedicated researcher, but admits that, after Hobman studied in vitro fertilization techniques in Vienna some 10 years ago, he became involved with "mind-healing" and with "holistics", which Weaver characterizes as just a euphemism for "untested."

Meanwhile, Vicki has also charged Henry and Coreen with interviewing the Deskins, successful Hobman clients whose testimony is featured on the Hobman website. Mr Deskin is happy to speak with them, although his wife passed away a few years ago after falling off a ladder. When Travis Deskin, the much-sought-after son, comes in the front door, Henry smells animal blood on him, and shifty-eyed Travis also seems wary of Henry. Coreen does a websearch and finds that a large number of pets have recently disappeared in the Deskin neighborhood. When Vicki hears about it, she tells Coreen to interview other parents of children conceived at the Hobman Clinic and to take Henry with her on the chance that Henry can detect anything similar in their children.

The next morning, Vicki is presented with an herbal drink that head nurse Jonah describes as consisting of black cohosh, red clover blossoms, dong quai, Chaste tree berry, and some other things that are all part of Dr Hobman's "patented treatment" and that serve the purpose of increasing the uterine lining and moistening the mucous membrane. As the day goes on, Vicki meets some of the other expectant mothers, such as Rachel Teertstra who is a relative newcomer to the Clinic but can't say enough about the spalike atmosphere. Marlisse Lafoy, the wife of Vicki's client, is on bedrest in the secluded wing for high risk pregnancies, but Vicki is allowed a short visit with her. Marlisse is elated that the birthdate is near, and when Vicki expresses her concern over being sequestered and her worries for the health of the babies, Marlisse proudly allows Vicki to feel her bulging abdomen. Expecting to feel a kick or two, Vicki is horrified when the entire outline of the baby's face and body starts pressing through the skin. Vicki reveals to Marlisse that she is a private investigator hired by Marlisse's husband, but something in the herbal cocktail Marlisse just drank is causing her to fall asleep.

That evening, when the herbal drinks are again passed out, Vicki dumps hers in a potted plant just as Rachel begins to scream with excitement. She's been informed that her HCG levels have doubled, meaning that she is pregnant. When Vicki gives her a congratulatory hug, Rachel assures Vicki that she's going to be next because Jonah likes her, and Jonah is seen as a lucky charm with an instinct for who is going to get pregnant. When Mike comes to visit after dinner, Vicki gives him a sample of both her and Marlisse's herbal drinks and asks him to get Dr Mohadevan to analyze them.

Meanwhile, Coreen and Henry are following up on some of the other parents who have gone through the Hobman Clinic, but Coreen isn't having much success. In fact, one set of parents actually hung up on her when Coreen phoned. Henry and Coreen talk again with Mr Deskin, who is more forthcoming this time. Deskin shows Coreen a photo of another Hobman baby who looks just like his son Travis, and he admits that he has questions about whether or not Travis is his, or even whether Travis is totally human. Seeing Travis riding around outside on his bike, Henry decides to follow him. Travis leads him to a secluded woods where he meets up with his friend Gabriel. When Travis makes Gabriel blindfold his eyes and then picks up a large butcher knife, Henry steps in. He sends Gabriel home after planting the idea that he will not play with Travis again. To Travis, Henry plants the suggestion that Travis will not harm any person or animal again. However, as Henry later reveals to Coreen, he's not sure how long that suggestion will hold. There's something dark and evil inside Travis, he feels, and it's ancient.

Time is getting short before Vicki's conception therapy is about to begin tomorrow. So, later that night, she goes snooping. She comes upon the hydrotherapy room and sees a patient seated in a hydrotub, chanting a mantra while Jonah massages her shoulders. Before Vicki can notice the darkness spreading from Jonah's hands into the water, Vicki is led away by Dr Hobman, who admonishes her for peeking in on another patient's privacy. After everyone has settled in for the night, she goes snooping again. She makes her way into the records room and looks up the charts for Marlisse, Rachel, and several other women, noticing that the one thing they all have in common is hydrotherapy, evidenced by a blue flag on their file folder. Vicki concludes that something is happening to them during their waterbaths. She also notices that her own folder bears a blue flag.

Dr Mahadevan has determined that the herbal drink Vicki provided contains simply what Jonah said it did, however, the other sample contains a drug that would make a person feel happy, sleepy, and compliant. When Vicki and Mike exchange information on the telephone in the morning and Vicki learns about the compliancy cocktail, she confronts Marlisse in her bedroom, warns her that her baby is in danger, and advises her to get out of the Clinic. Marlisse, having seen her baby's face pressing through her skin just as Vicki saw it, realizes that Vicki is telling the truth and agrees to leave. As Vicki wheels Marlisse out of her room, she is stopped by Jonah. Jonah knocks Vicki to the floor and locks her in Marlisse's bedroom.

Henry and Coreen spent the night searching for information about the "blackness" that Henry felt inside of Travis Deskin. Coreen thinks he may be a swartalfen (black elf), legendary creatures known to switch their own "twisted, unwanted offspring" for a more desirable human child. In another book, Henry learns that the swartalfen of Protogermanic myth is an evil elf who impregnates women with his demon seed. As the children of these dark elves grow older, they begin to spread death and destruction wherever they go. Coreen thinks that Travis may be one of these alfenkinder, and Henry is concerned that Vicki is in their den, so he rushes to the Clinic.

Mike has done some more searching on Richard Hobman's background as well as on Jonah. He's learned nothing incriminating about Hobman, but when Jonah turns up as having been a general physician practicing medicine in the 1940s, looking the same as he looks in 2007, Mike heads for the Clinic albeit not before Coreen stops by to tell him about the swartalfen and to give him a bag of iron swords, pokers, and tire irons on the chance that the swartalfen can be killed with iron.

At the Clinic, Henry has found Vicki and is trying to talk her into leaving with him, but Vicki wants to stay in order to finish off the swartalfen. They head down the hall looking for Jonah just as Marlisse is wheeled into the birthing room. Suddenly, a cloud of fog fills the hallway, and Vicki and Henry are separated. They stumble around in the fog until Jonah in his swartalfen form appears and grabs Vicki. Henry wrestles with him just as Mike shows up and knocks out the swartalfen with one of Coreen's tire irons. The fog clears but Jonah is nowhere to be seen, so they all three go looking for him.

Jonah is in Marlisse's room, watching as Dr Hobman hands her a baby boy. Jonah asks to hold it. As he takes the baby in his arms, he reverts to his swartalfen form. Henry and Vicki rush at him, but Vicki drops her iron sword. Mike steps forward to swing his tire iron, but Marlisse stabs the swartalfen with the iron sword that Vicki dropped. Henry grabs the baby as the swartalfen disintegrates until he is just a small pool of blood on the floor. As Dr Hobman is led away in handcuffs and Marlisse, Mitch, and their baby are reunited, Mike and Vicki wonder whether the baby is a swartalfen. Henry says that the connection was broken when Jonah was killed but that he could still feel a darkness inside the child. "Let's just hope it takes after its mother's side of the family," says Vicki.

Meanwhile, as two young boys walk their dog, Travis Deskin watches them from across the street, his pointed little ears clearly visible under his cap. [Full synopsis by bj_kuehl]

description: Norman is back from his demon dimension, and things are not looking good for Vicki.
synopsis_with_character_names:
When Camille Stokes, claiming to be psychic, shows up at the office of P.I. Vicki Nelson to warn her about a vision in which a demon is going to kill Vicki after he has amassed three objects -- a chalice, a grimoire, and a dagger -- Vicki is understandably shaken. Only a few months ago, Norman Bridewell, known to the public as the "Vampire Killer," was about to sacrifice Vicki in a ritual to unleash the demon Astaroth from Hell and bring an Apocalypse upon the Earth. Vicki survived, only because vampire Henry Fitzroy was able to recite the incantation that sent both Norman and Astaroth back to hell, although Vicki now sports a mysterious pentagram on each wrist as a daily reminder of the experience. Camille's warning is even more believable because a chalice, grimoire, and dagger were the three magical objects that Norman used to summon Astaroth. Fortunately, Henry destroyed those objects. Or did he? When Vicki asks Henry if he kept his promise to destroy the objects, he becomes evasive. It turns out that he merely separated them and had each one placed in a safe place. Vicki is irate and demands that he get them back and destroy them for good. After all, her soul may depend upon it.

Henry agrees, and they first go looking for the chalice. Henry charged Maurice Baloc, a dealer in antiques who hates demons and black magic as much as Henry does, with hiding the chalice. However, Baloc refuses to give it back, reminding Henry of his order to never reveal the location of the chalice to anyone, including Henry. Not even Henry's assurance that the situation has changed will get Baloc to change his mind, so Henry and Vicki leave the shop empty-handed. Vicki and Henry are unaware that it was actually Norman Bridewell in the form of Camille Stokes who warned Vicki about a "vision" so that she would lead him to the objects. Norman has managed to return to Earth from Hell when the renter of his former apartment, a hockey player and body builder, cut his hand while lifting weights, and the blood fell on the floorboards where Norman had drawn the magic circle used to summon Astaroth. Not long after Vicki and Henry leave Baloc's antique shop, Norman shapeshifts into Vicki and tries once more to get Baloc to release the chalice, but Baloc has placed a concealment spell on it. Even he doesn't know its whereabouts, Baloc says, so Norman simply slits his throat with his long, black fingernails, knowing that the magic dies with the person who cast it. The chalice suddenly appears in full view on a table, and Norman walks away with it.

Meanwhile, TPD Detective Mike Celluci has been called to investigate a homicide. Since Dave Graham, his usual partner, is tied up in court all week, Mike takes along rookie Kate Lam, who is able to identify the body as that of a hockey player by his strong forearms and calloused palms. The body was found with his neck slashed and all the blood drained out, an M.O. that reminds them of the "Vampire Killer" from a few months back. Concerned that Vicki may be in danger, Mike suggests that she hide out at his brother's place in Mexico, but Vicki reminds him that a demon can find her regardless of where she runs. Mike winds up agreeing to help her locate whomever might be trying to summon Astaroth again.

The next night, as Vicki and Henry are walking down the street, they discuss collecting the grimoire, which Henry has placed in the care of his friend and one-time lover, Dr Betty Sagara, a professor of Demonology at the University. As Vicki and Henry discuss the dagger's whereabouts, they are unaware of the bum pawing through a nearby trashpile. That bum is actually Norman Bridewell. Now that Norman knows the location of the grimoire, he races over to Sagara's office and, after shapeshifting into Henry, requests the return of the grimoire, which Sagara has locked in a safe hidden behind a bookshelf.

After obtaining the grimoire from Sagara, Norman (still in Henry's form) goes to Vicki's office where he comes on to Vicki. Surprisingly, Vicki responds and, for the first time, kisses "Henry." Norman repays her by knocking her out. He then goes to Henry's condo, this time in Vicki's form, and does the same to Henry. While Henry lies on the floor, recovering from the slashes across his chest, aware that this is not the real Vicki, "Vicki" sniffs around the room until he smells the dagger hidden behind a wall panel. Using Henry's head, "Vicki" smashes open the panel and retrieves the knife. Quick as a flash, Henry grabs the knife from Norman's hand and holds it to her throat. "Vicki" points out that he might only have shapeshifted into Vicki Nelson's form but he might also have possessed Vicki's body. If Henry slashes "Vicki's" neck, he's taking the chance that he might be killing the real Vicki. Is Henry willing to take that chance?

Fortunately, the real Vicki solves Henry's dilemma by breaking into his condo at just that moment, and Henry realizes that "Vicki" is not Vicki. Vicki goes after "Vicki" with her baton, then notices that the pentagrams on her wrists have started to glow. With the increased strength of the pentagrams, Vicki is able to defeat "Vicki," who returns to his form as Norman before shifting into a flock of bats and flying away, leaving the dagger behind. Vicki rushes to Henry's side as he lay on the floor and asks whether he was just in her apartment kissing her. Henry denies it, and Vicki scowls when she realizes that she was actually kissing Norman. "But I hate to waste it," she says and plants a kiss on Henry's lips.

Now that Norman knows where the dagger is, Henry fears he will return, whereas Vicki fears for Coreen's safety. Vicki calls Coreen, and, sure enough, Norman has faked his way into the office by taking the form of Camille Stokes. Before Coreen can even answer the ringing telephone, Norman covers her mouth with his hand and answers the phone for her. He orders Vicki to bring the dagger to his apartment or kiss Coreen goodbye.

Meanwhile, Mike and Kate are at the Coroner's office to view another body found in a dumpster. Dr Mohadevan has identified the victim as Camille Stokes and estimates that she's been dead for several days. Mike recognizes the name as the psychic who visited Vicki and, when he hears her address -- 52 Lonigan Street -- he recognizes it as the same building where Norman "the Vampire Killer" Bridewell used to live. Just then, his cellphone rings. It is Vicki, calling to tell him that Norman is back and that he has Coreen. She agrees to meet Mike at Norman's apartment. Bothered by Mike's secrecy about this case and feeling that he's been shutting her out in favor of Vicki, Kate issues an ultimatum that Mike either let her in on what's happening or go it alone. Mike promises to tell her later, so Kate walks out.

Vicki and Henry have arrived at Norman's apartment to find him waiting, Coreen's hands bound, and the pentagram redrawn. Henry asks that Norman take him instead of Vicki, but Norman wants only Vicki and the dagger. Vicki takes the dagger from Henry and walks toward Norman just as Mike appears in the doorway, ordering her not to do it. Nonplussed, Norman magically binds both Mike and Henry against the wall and orders Vicki to bring him the dagger. Vicki tosses it at Norman, but he catches it neatly. He releases Coreen, grabs Vicki, and begins the incantation that opens the portal in the pentagram. He cuts Vicki's palm with the dagger and spills her blood into the chalice.

Suddenly, the dagger blade begins to glow and the blood in the chalice starts to bubble. "What did you do?" Norman screams. "Had the dagger blessed by a priest on the way over," Vicki tells him. "Oh, crap!" Norman howls, realizing that it's all over. His holds on Mike and Henry are released. Henry jumps at Norman, grabs the dagger away, and stabs him with it. Shocked at the sudden turn of events, Norman tells Vicki that the pentagrams are not a curse but a gift and that, if she would embrace them, she could have anything she wants. Norman is then sucked back into the portal while yelling, "I will be back!"

Epilogue: Henry promises to really destroy the magical objects this time, and he and Vicki compare notes on what happened between Norman and each of them when they thought it was each other, eventually agreeing to forget anything ever happened. [Full synopsis by bj_kuehl]

They are very close to losing the house. Yet, the basement boys go see Star Wars in Kenosha and are instantly hooked, especially Eric. Kelso is instantly obsessed, wanting to see it repeatedly. Red is happy as a clam to hear Mr. Milbank has returned to re-open the plant full time and promises Kitty a celebratory dinner and a movie.

Eric's 'Jedi knight joy' gets a first blow when he is ordered to be nice to the boss's son, David Milbank (Scott Whyte). Eric had beat up David when he was still sickly (he had asthma back when he was a little boy), and now David has turned out to be bigger than any of the gang (David is tall and Handsome now). David starts hitting on Donna from the get-go. David pretends to be interested in Donna's short stories and goes over to her house to spend time with her. Donna is upset when Eric points to her that David is hitting on her. Donna says she is only friends with David. Eric says that Donna is naive as David just wants to seduce Donna. Which is why any guy pays attention to any girl. The gang tells Eric to fight for Donna and confront David.

Eric has a Star Wars dream. Eric as Luke Skywalker, Hyde as Han Solo, Kelso as Chewbacca, Red as Obi-Wan Kenobi, Fez and Jackie as Imperial Stormtroopers, Donna as Princess Leia, David as Darth Vader, and Kitty as a cleaning woman using R2-D2 as a vacuum cleaner. When Red finds that David is making a move on Donna, he teaches the uppercut to Eric.

Kelso wants Jackie to come with him to see Star Wars. Jackie proposes sex instead, but Kelso says that they can have sex anytime they want. Laurie hits on Kelso and kisses him when Jackie won't go with Kelso for Star Wars. Eric goes to confront David, who admits that he is interested in Donna. Donna says that they are friends, but David tells Donna to grow up. He spent time with Donna and listened to her poems so he could seduce her. David agrees with Eric that he had every reason to kick David's behind. Donna is disgusted that Eric does not trust her or respect her and leaves.

David tells Eric that it wouldn't have worked out with Donna anyways since the plant will be closing soon and David will move out of Point Place then. The plant was opened full time to burn off the inventory and then would be closed for good. Eric uppercuts David. Eric doesn't tell Red about the bad news and lets his parents enjoy their celebratory night together (They are going for a dinner and a movie together). Laurie tells Eric that she has flunked out of college and had just made out with Kelso.

The unsavory idea even gets Laurie's sympathy, yet he rather lets them thinks he's on drugs. Meanwhile, Red's very emotional brother Marty (Pat Skipper) has arrived and is a millstone around Red's neck. Red is embarrassed by his emotional brother Marty. Laurie doesn't mourn but sees the advantages of her grandma's death. She had a paper coming up in the week which she was going to flunk and now has the perfect excuse.

Eric is depressed and Donna encourages him to talk to Red about how he feels. Eric says that talking is not going to help him. Only drinking can. Hyde takes him drinking instead. Eric and the guys go to a bar pretending to be soldiers, get hit on by some girls (Charlotte and Charlene) and end up in a fight. The boyfriends of the 2 girls arrive and pick a fight with the gang. They knock Eric out cold, prompting Hyde and Kelso to attack them. Fez stands by and continues his conversation with the girls. Eric comes home at 2 am and Marty encourages him to let out his feelings, while Red orders him to bottle it up again. Red sends Kitty and Marty to sleep and has a beer with Eric. Kitty hides her mixed feelings by cooking.

At the funeral, Jackie and Kelso have sex (Jackie thinks Humans are fragile beings). Kelso makes awkward comments, Fez consoles Red and is re-directed to Marty. At the open casket, Kitty asks Bernice to be nicer to God. Jackie is perplexed that people get old and die. Hyde eyes the ring on Bernice's finger. Fez is horrified to find a body in the casket. Red cant say anything.

Red finds a train set in Bernice's things and fights Marty for it (even though it belonged to Marty). Marty wants Red to admit that he wants the trains, but Red is only willing to show that by keeping the trains that he is doing a favor to Marty. Marty leaves the train set for Red as he loves playing with it. Eric admits to Red his last words to his Grandmom and Red laughs it off saying "It could only happen to you son". Kitty finally mourns for Bernice when she runs out of eggs and flour.

Note: This episode takes place in 1976 instead of 1977

While riding in Eric's car, Kelso has the brilliant idea to go skinny-dipping at the reservoir, but all their clothes get stolen, so the basement gang goes to Hyde's home to borrow his and his mother's clothes, so they'll have something to wear. Eric finds that Hyde's mother has run off with a trucker. Hyde is living all alone in the house. Hyde says that they have food, beer and zero adult supervision.

Jackie catches a cold from the reservoir and ends up in bed. Kelso is horrified at her ill appearance and turns away from her. But later Kelso apologizes to Jackie saying that this illness is temporary and soon she will be hot and pretty, just like her mom (which also gives him hope for the future). Kelso is convinced that Jackie's physical beauty will last forever.

Midge's Feminist Warriors - which no other husband puts up with - decide to meet at Midge's place every week. The group keeps making Midge crazy with their anti-male talk. Midge points out the female suppression in the English language with words like mail-man. Midge calls Bob a part of the problem. Yet member Sharon actually proves an old-fashioned caring housewife at heart when she finds good provider Bob feeling neglected. Sharon says that a hard-working man who provides for his family, deserves to come home to a hot meal, and not eat a cold sandwich by himself. Bob starts developing feelings for Sharon and animosity towards Midge, which Donna picks up on. Donna sees that Bob is all dressed up in his finest suits whenever Sharon is supposed to visit the house.

Red feels that with the car plant about to close, money is too tight even to afford pork chops. Yet Kitty and Eric implicitly expect him to play "Santa Claus" for home-wrecked Hyde after his mother abandons him. It starts with Eric asking Red if Hyde can stay over for the night. Red agrees but asks Eric to split his pork chop with Hyde. Eric finds out that Hyde had to pawn his color TV for cash. And he overhears Hyde talking to Edna over the phone and finding that Edna is not planning to come back. Donna joins the pot circle for the first time. Hyde is not there, and Eric tells the gang that Edna is not coming back. Donna gets high and decides to count all the molecules in her body.

When food and supplies grow low for Hyde at Edna's rented house, Eric persuades his parents to take Hyde in. Red is not in favor of having another mouth to feed in the house, But Kitty asks Red to at least pay a visit to Hyde. Kitty and Red visit Hyde. The house is a mess, with garbage everywhere and no furniture to speak of. Kitty tells Red that she cannot allow Hyde to live like this. Red is reluctant as he doesn't have the money. Kitty starts to cry and Red cannot stand it anymore. He orders Hyde to get his stuff in the car. Hyde is angry at Eric since now Red yells at him all the time and back home, Hyde didn't have to answer to anybody. But deep down, Hyde is thankful to have a roof over his head and Kitty fawning over him with hot cocoa and cookies.

Hyde has pancakes and syrup for breakfast which were considered a luxury back with Edna. When Red wants some chores done around the house, Hyde is the first to raise his hand. Eric's initial happiness with the brother he never had soon turns in frustration as Hyde constantly gets high praise and is even set as an example for Eric, while Eric is now kid no. 3. Eric is asked to be more like Hyde. When Eric confronts Hyde, Hyde calls him a lazy, spoiled brat. Eric says that he has been doing the chores for 16 years and Hyde is making him look bad.

Eric listens to one of Kelso's worst-advised ideas... He sets about coercing Hyde to do destructive things. Instead, Eric ends up bouncing a bowling ball off the couch and breaks the TV, despite Hyde begging him not to do so as nothing good can come off it. Kelso and Fez run away pronto. Hyde tries to cover for Eric, but Red punishes them both by asking them to get a job and buy him a new TV. Red wants a brand new model with a remote and a 26 inch screen.

Fights between Midge and Bob get worse. Midge wants Bob to do the dishes, but Bob says that the feminist philosophy has gone to her head. Bob warns Eric that Donna is likely to turn out the same way. Jackie advice Donna that she can play off Bob and Midge for her affections and come out ahead. She can have twice as much stuff, twice as many clothes and her parents will fight over who gets to buy her a car. Donna is worried that her parents might end up being divorced.

Red's fellow Korea veteran Bull (Mitch Pileggi) is in Point Place, showing off to him and Bob as a success in business selling hot tubs with a young, attractive wife. Bull even offers Red a job since he is opening up a Hot Tub store in Point Place. Red, jealous of Bull's success, reconsiders his life choices, but changes his mind after Bull and his wife (Arlene Pileggi) invite Red and Kitty to a swingers party. Bob and Midge are also invited and Sharon is also there with her husband. When Kitty finds out she asks Red to leave. Red then takes Bob and Midge back with him, even though Bob badly wanted to stay.

Michael and his siblings The morning of his father's retirement, Michael Bluth felt optimistic that his father, George Bluth, will make him the president of the Bluth Company. Michael finds his brother G.O.B. and asks for his check for the party, to which G.O.B. responds that he will be performing the Aztec Tomb illusion at the party and suggests Michael charge the party to the company's credit card. He then lets slip that their sister Lindsay has been charging her month-long visit to the city to the company.

Michael visits his mother Lucille at her apartment and confronts her about using the company credit card on Lindsay. He learns that the company has also paid $16,000 for the Aztec Tomb and $40,000 to Lindsay's anti-circumcision charity H.O.O.P.. Lindsay and her husband Tobias Fünke arrive at Lucille's apartment and Michael gives them all an impassioned speech about the virtue of hard work.

At the retirement party aboard the Marina Hornblower George decides to name Lucille president of the company, and quietly apologizes to Michael. Michael makes the decision to move him and his son to Arizona away from his family's self-delusions and selfishness when the SEC raids the party and takes George into custody. Buster, Michael's younger brother and perpetual graduate student, attempts to steer the boat to freedom but suffers from a panic attack.

The family gathers at the police station where they learn George will be kept in custody and all accounts have been frozen. The family reacts to the latter. Lucille names Buster to be acting president of the Bluth company but he suffers another panic attack. The family, tired of attempting to find other work, asks Michael to come back and help run the company. Michael realizes they legitimately need his help and that his son would be better off with more family in his life, so he agrees to stay.

George Michael and Maeby While working at the banana stand, a Bluth family operation since the 1950s, George Michael is approached by Mae "Maeby" Fünke, his cousin that he rarely sees. She suggests they make out at the retirement party to teach Lindsay a lesson about keeping them separated. George Michael expresses fear that it is illegal.

At the party, Maeby grabs George Michael and kisses him as Lindsay passes. Lindsay doesn't notice and Maeby sulks off. George Michael, however, is aroused by the kiss and begins to struggle with feelings toward his cousin. He becomes incredibly uncomfortable when he learns that he and Maeby will be sharing a bedroom in the model home.

Tobias's piracy Ever since Tobias lost his psychiatrist license after performing C.P.R. on a sleeping man he had been searching for a new life calling. When Michael jokingly suggested the retirement party was pirate themed, Tobias took it seriously. He dressed in Lindsay's clothes and accidentally boarded a boat with some gay men to protest the yacht club's refusal to let gays marry at sea. He befriended the men and realized he wanted to be an actor.

Maeby, meanwhile, stands for the opposite of what her mother stands for, claiming she is a hypocrite. George Michael agrees with whatever Maeby stands for, hoping to get her attention.

Lindsay sneaks out the tree at night and Johnny follows her, professing his love for her. The tree is ripped down as she shoots him down, apologizing for leading him on.
